wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Marcus John Slade (22 January 1801 – 7 March 1872) was a British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Guernsey.

response: * Marcus Slade (1801–1872), British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Guernsey

In 1909, Marling married Lucia Slade, the only daughter of Sir John Ramsay Slade and granddaughter of Marcus Slade. They had two daughters and a son. Lucia died in 1927 in a motoring accident at Deippe, France. Marling died at his London home on 16 February 1933 aged 70.

Slade was born at Berwick House in Berwick St Leonard, Wiltshire, into a distinguished military family, the eldest of four sons of Lieutenant-General Marcus Slade and his wife, Charlotte Ramsay. He was the grandson of General Sir John Slade, 1st Baronet and great-grandson of George Ramsay, 8th Earl of Dalhousie, and nephew of Admiral Sir Adolphus Slade.
